column2: Register functional images to a standard MNI152 template or EPI template. This option must be enabled if you wish to calculate any derivatives.
The resolution (in mm) to which functional images are transformed during registration.
column3: 1 An interger indicating three same dimensions (e.g., 1mm, 2mm, 3mm, 4mm); 2 A float number indicating three same dimensions (e.g., 3.5mm etc.); 3 Three numbers connected by 'x' indicating three different dimensions (e.g., 2.67mmx2.67mmx3mm etc.)

column2: The resolutions to resample the normalized functional timeseries to.
column3: 1 An interger indicating three same dimensions (e.g., 1mm, 2mm, 3mm, 4mm); 2 A float number indicating three same dimensions (e.g., 3.5mm etc.); 3 Three numbers connected by 'x' indicating three different dimensions (e.g., 2.67mmx2.67mmx3mm etc.)

column2: Standard FSL Skull Stripped Template. Reference image for resampling during functional registration.
Standard FSL Template with skull. Reference image for resampling during functional registration.
Matrix containing all 1’s. Used as an identity matrix during registration. It is not necessary to change this path unless you intend to use non-standard MNI registration.
Reference image for functional EPI registration.

Parameters setting for antsRegistration when run functional to EPI template registration.The user can specify any number of 'stages' where a stage consists of a transform; an image metric; and iterations, shrink factors, and smoothing sigmas for each level. Note that explicitly setting the dimensionality, metric, transform, output, convergence, shrink-factors, and smoothing-sigmas parameters is mandatory.
column3: See below for a full specification of parameters.
